website_summaries.verdict: It's harder and more varied than its original release, but Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge doesn't reach the greatness of its forebears.
pros: Bloody, dramatic swordplay is a blast to watchCertain battles and boss fights test your skill in entertaining waysAdditional weapons and Ayane chapters provide variety
cons: The controls can't always keep up with the actionFrustrating fluctuations of difficulty levelsStory falls flat

customer_reviews.title: Horrible game for the ninja gaiden series
customer_reviews.text: Horrible game for the ninja gaiden series. Taken as a regular hack n slash game its just OK. But its also bad in alot of ways too which can kill enjoyment. Really not a very polished game. Camera is all over the place, some of the combat has some cool elements but overall this game is nothing special. There are some decent moments but the whole game is tainted by a one weapon approach, worse and simpler combat, spastic camera and various other issues. Playable though.
customer_reviews.author: game collector

customer_reviews.title: Skip on the wiiu port if you can
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay game. But don't get it on wiiu, it takes forever to load and you're going to die a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Redbeard

customer_reviews.title: Great game, bit difficult
customer_reviews.text: This reminds me a lot of the original NES game in the difficulty level. It'll take some time to master for certain. The game did freeze on me once while I tried to shut down during the first boss fight. Been fine since then though. Unlike previous "bloody" games Nintendo has allowed on their systems, this game hasn't been de-bloodified. You have all the violence you might expect from a PS3 version. The controls are excellent once you get use to them. Haven't been completely sold on the Wii-U touchscreen for everyday use but the game does a nice job of integrating it. Overall, a solid 4 maybe 4.5 stars for me. Was certainly worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Action Game for the Wii U
customer_reviews.text: Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge is a satisfyingly difficult action game chock full of blood and viscera. Compared to the vanilla version of Ninja Gaiden 3, Razor's Edge is slightly superior. The exclusion of healing items and the amped up enemy intelligence results in a considerably greater difficulty level. The Wii U gamepad screen is minimally utilized while playing the game on the television, but the gamepad screen may be used as the primary game screen. Overall, Ninja Gaiden: Razor's Edge is a competent, albeit slightly flawed, action game. If you enjoy fast paced action with a near masochistic level of challenge, then this game is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The Definitive NG3 Experience!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad the Wii U version of Ninja Gaiden 3 is completely different than the atrocious XBOX 360 & PS3 versions. On the Wii U version we actually get dismemberment & copious amounts of blood.We also get increased difficulty and added stages. I wish Nintendo would learn to actually market their products. I didn't even know the Wii U version was any different until I took it upon myself to research.
customer_reviews.author: bettina c

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails, but fun as hell!
customer_reviews.text: I must start with the fact of the price cut. This game is worth the original retail price and now half the price is your chance to pick it up. This is a beat em' up/masher game that offers strategy and severe challenge. I'm now more eager to play other Ninja Gaiden and Team Ninja titles. I will warn though, like every other game in this genre, it is repetitive. This is a great game that will make me personally look forward to a sequel.

customer_reviews.title: A big improvement that still has room for more
customer_reviews.text: Fixes the disastrous Ninja Gaiden 3 in a huge way by getting rid of QTE nonsense and bringing combat back up to the series standard. There are still some major problems however, most of them having to do with the broken health system that makes the (poorly designed) boss fights unreasonably frustrating. For an apology of a game it's surprisingly good, but still leaves much room for improvement.

product_meta.title: Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge - Nintendo Wii U
product_meta.description: The solidary Ninja, Ryu Hayabusa, must find a way to lift the deadly curse on his right arm before it destroys him… NINJA GAIDEN 3 has been reworked to bring to Wii U the truly intense, high-speed challenge and action NINJA GAIDEN fans demand. With more weapon and Ninpo types, a new character progression system, a redesigned battle system and the return of dismemberment, NINJA GAIDEN 3: Razor’s Edge improves upon the original NINJA GAIDEN 3 in every way and offers Wii U exclusive features and functionalities.
